history.content:
intechquity is an online event that explores the crossroads between tech and gentrification. Gentrification is something that is very relevant to us as not only residents of the Bay Area, but also as future tech industry workers. It is important for us to both recognize the impact of our field and work towards concrete solutions. Our goal is for students to walk away from this event with more awareness about tech's impact on gentrification and knowledge of tangible solutions.

Hosted by Berkeley ANova, intechquity will take place on April 27th from 7-8 p.m. Our featured speaker is Megan Abell, the Director of Advocacy at TechEquity Collaborative. TechEquity Collaborative's mission is to mobilize tech workers and companies to advance structural change that addresses economic inequity at its roots, focusing on housing and workforce & labor.

We hope you can join us! RSVP on our Facebook Event: https://fb.me/e/1j2zMBWNo

This is the second event of ANova's intechquity series for the 2020-2021 school year. Visit http://go.berkeleyanova.org/intechquity to learn more about our fall event.
history.subject: Berkeley ANova—intechquity (4/27)
